articles.title: Argentina says corn exports are 'open' despite new international sales policy
articles.description: Argentina's corn export market remains "open" despite a new government policy that prioritizes crops that are already harvested over forward sales of the upcoming 2021/22 crop, a statement issued by the agriculture ministry said on Tuesday.

articles.title: UN panel says it can’t rule on climate case brought by Greta Thunberg
articles.description: The 15 activists, aged between eight and 17 at the time, had argued that France, Turkey, Brazil, Germany and Argentina had known about the risk of climate change for decades but failed to curb their carbon emissions.
articles.content:
A UN panel said it could not immediately rule on a complaint by Swedish teenager Greta Thunberg and others that state inaction on climate change violates children’s rights, adding that they should have taken the case to national courts first.

articles.title: Argentina prioritizes sales of harvested corn over sales of next crop - source
